intro: Lasiandra hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Lasiandra hirsuta is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
